sentences: Ta on oma aja haritumaid naisi.
context: The word 'Ãµpid' appears to be part of the Estonian word 'aega', which means time, period, age, or era. In the provided sentences, it's used in different contexts: 1) as a temporal reference ('ammust aega' - for a long time), 2) as an historical period oma aja - one's own time/era), and 3) as a specific time zone reference (Kesk-Euroopa aeg - Central European Time). The word 'aeg' is highly versatile in Estonian, referring to various concepts related to temporal measurement, historical periods, and appropriate moments.
